description: From Latin ēnormis. An assimilated form of ex- (“out of”) + norma (“rule, norm”) + -ous.

adjectives.description: enormous (comparative more enormous, superlative most enormous)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Deviating from the norm; unusual, extraordinary.
examples: all shall be rather enforced than hindered, except they be dismembered, or grievously deformed, infirm, or visited with some enormous hereditary disease is body or mind […].

Men would prove wolves and vipers; tigers and dragons mixt in one and the same person to each other. O bless God for this great gift of Princes and Judges to rule the wicked and enormous world and to sway the scepter of righteousness  […]

entries.meaning: Extremely large; greatly exceeding the common size, extent, etc.
